content: Did I miss a communication announcing common / shared workflow extensions? For example, I have http://build.fhir.org/extension-communicationrequest-relevanthistory.html, but I also see what appears to be a common extension, http://build.fhir.org/extension-request-relevanthistory.html. Is there a recommendation to leverage the common extensions versus creating resource-specific extensions? If so, should we be creating extensions when common extension are missing? For example, I don't see a request-instantiatescanonical -- should I have made http://build.fhir.org/extension-communicationrequest-instantiatescanonical.html a shared/common extension?
I made all mine common so I could use them across the OO resources. Thought it was known.
Please use the common ones - workflow reports will complain otherwise. And yes, feel free to add new ones if need be. Name them the same as the event element, following the existing pattern
yes make them shared/common if'n they don't exist - @Lloyd McKenzie can you cc all the editors this little know fact?
I don't know all the editors. I can post something on committers though.
Truth be told, I heard they were coming, but didn't realize (until now) that they are available. I have some legacy extensions and new ones that will all need to be reworked.
